Definition: Radiculopathy is a condition caused by compression or irritation of a nerve root in the spine.
Causes: Herniated discs, spinal stenosis, and degenerative disc disease.
Symptoms: Pain, numbness, and weakness along the affected nerve.
Diagnosis: Physical examination, imaging studies, and nerve conduction studies.
Treatment: Physical therapy, medications, and sometimes surgery.

Definition: Radioactive iodine induced sialadenitis is inflammation of the salivary glands caused by radioactive iodine treatment.
Causes: Radioactive iodine therapy for thyroid conditions.
Symptoms: Swelling, pain, and dryness in the mouth.

Definition: A rash is a change in the skin that affects its color, appearance, or texture.
Treatment: Depends on the underlying cause; may include topical treatments and medications.

Definition: Reactive arthritis is a type of inflammatory arthritis that occurs in response to an infection in another part of the body.
Causes: Infections, particularly in the genitourinary or gastrointestinal tract.
Treatment: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) and treatment of the underlying infection.

Definition: Rectal cancer is a type of cancer that develops in the rectum, the last part of the large intestine.
Causes: Genetic factors, diet, and inflammatory bowel disease.
Symptoms: Rectal bleeding, changes in bowel habits, and abdominal pain.

Definition: Rectal prolapse occurs when the rectum protrudes through the anus.
Causes: Weak pelvic floor muscles, chronic constipation, and aging.
Symptoms: Visible protrusion of the rectum, discomfort, and bleeding.
Treatment: Surgery and management of underlying conditions.

Definition: Renovascular hypertension is high blood pressure caused by narrowing of the arteries that supply blood to the kidneys.
Symptoms: High blood pressure, headaches, and sometimes kidney dysfunction.

Definition: Restless leg syndrome is a neurological disorder characterized by an uncontrollable urge to move the legs.
Causes: Genetic factors, iron deficiency, and certain medications.
Symptoms: Uncomfortable sensations in the legs, especially at night.
Treatment: Lifestyle changes, medications, and iron supplementation if needed.

Definition: Restrictive cardiomyopathy is a condition where the heart muscle becomes rigid and less able to expand.
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, fatigue, and swelling in the legs.
Treatment: Management of symptoms and treatment of underlying causes.

Definition: Rhabdomyosarcoma is a rare type of cancer that develops from skeletal muscle tissue.
Causes: Exact cause is often unknown; may involve genetic factors.
Symptoms: Lump or swelling, pain, and functional impairment.

Definition: Rheumatoid arthritis is an autoimmune disorder that primarily affects the joints.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown; may involve genetic and environmental factors.
Diagnosis: Clinical evaluation, blood tests, and imaging studies.
Treatment: Medications, physical therapy, and lifestyle changes.

Definition: Rheumatoid lung disease refers to lung complications associated with rheumatoid arthritis.
Causes: Autoimmune response related to rheumatoid arthritis.
Symptoms: Cough, shortness of breath, and chest pain.
Diagnosis: Imaging studies and pulmonary function tests.
Treatment: Management of rheumatoid arthritis and respiratory symptoms.

Definition: Rosacea is a chronic skin condition that causes redness and visible blood vessels in the face.
Causes: Exact cause is unknown; may involve genetic and environmental factors.
Symptoms: Facial redness, flushing, and acne-like breakouts.
Treatment: Topical treatments, oral medications, and lifestyle modifications.

Definition: A rotator cuff injury involves damage to the group of muscles and tendons that stabilize the shoulder.
Symptoms: Shoulder pain, weakness, and limited range of motion.
Treatment: Physical therapy, medications, and sometimes surgery.
